title: Denmark and Greenland hit Trump administration's intransigence
subhed: Danish Foreign Minister Lars Lokke Rasmussen and his Greenlandic counterpart, Vivian Motzfeldt, were in Washington on Wednesday for a crisis meeting with Vice President JD Vance and Secretary of State Marco Rubio.

title: France's government survives no-confidence votes as budget deadlock deepens
byline: By Mariama Darame and Nathalie Segaunes

title: 'In the face of Trump's imperialism, realism means defending the law as an indispensable tool'
Uganda's veteran guerrilla, Yoweri Museveni, seeks a seventh term
subhed: In power for 40 years, the president once again stands before voters on Thursday, in a tightly controlled election amid mounting repression and open nepotism.

title: Gaza racked by uncertainty about 'second phase' of Trump's ceasefire plan
subhed: The White House said it would start its project to set up the Palestinian territory's new administration. However, the so-called 'Board of Peace,' which is meant to oversee a Palestinian national committee comprised of technocrats, has yet to be formed.

title: A rare 16th-century drawing by the master Hans Baldung Grien auctioned in Paris
subhed: The portrait of Susanna Pfeffinger, which has remained within her descendants' family, is valued at between €1.5 million and €3 million.

title: Greenlanders overwhelmed by Trump's ambitions: '$10,000 to annex the island, who does he think we are?'
subhed: Denmark deployed military reinforcements to the Inuit island on Wednesday evening, shortly after the US vice president and secretary of state and the Danish and Greenlandic foreign ministers met in Washington.
byline: By Isabelle Mandraud (Nuuk, Greenland, special correspondent)

title: Trump says Iran has halted executions as Tehran postpones hanging of protester
Behind France's declining birthrate, the complex question of wanting children
Inside Dubai's unprecedented seizure of drug traffickers' real estate assets
byline: By  Abdelhak El Idrissi and Jérémie Baruch

title: West Bank's Birzeit University still reeling one week after Israeli army fired on students
Zelensky to declare 'state of emergency' in Ukraine's energy sector
Iran's crackdown reaches unprecedented levels: 'There were layers of bodies stacked on top of each other'
X announces measures to prevent Grok from undressing images
ICE agent shoots man in the leg in Minneapolis
Katie Miller, chief 'MAGA Mom'
Venezuela's interim president announces 'new political era'
South Korean prosecutors seek death penalty for Yoon Suk Yeol over martial law declaration
AFCON 2025: Morocco beats Nigeria on penalties to reach final against Senegal
byline: Le Monde with AP and AFP

title: After celebrating Maduro ouster, Venezuelan migrants in US fear what lies ahead
subhed: After celebrating the abduction of Nicolas Maduro, Venezuelan asylum seekers in the US have begun to have doubts. In Denver, Colorado, where they number in the tens of thousands, many now fear having to go back to their country with the Chavistas still in power.

title: 'The Islamic Republic of Iran is entering its final phase'
subhed: Hemmed in by domestic and external crises, the Islamic Republic of Iran is now finding itself with nowhere left to turn, analyzes Farid Vahid, the co-director of the Observatory of North Africa and the Middle East at the Fondation Jean Jaurès.

title: Reza Pahlavi, the son of Iran's shah fanning the flames of revolt
subhed: The son of Iran's former monarch, driven out of the country by the 1979 Islamic Revolution, has repeatedly called for protests against the Tehran regime. Crowds chant his name, and from his US exile, he has increasingly positioned himself as a leader of the movement.
byline: By Claire Gatinois and Ghazal Golshiri

title: President Trump, Greenland does not want to become American
'Instead of commenting on the unthinkable, Europeans should take action in Greenland'
'The raw and brutal display of American power in the Trump II era is finally opening the eyes of Washington's allies'
